    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • tag

        public RequestCreator tag(java.lang.String tag)
        Assigns a reference tag to this request. Leaving this empty will automatically generate a tag.
        Parameters:
        tag -

      • search

        public RequestCreator search(java.lang.String search)
        Looks up a specific query on the RSS feed. The query string is automatically encoded.
        Parameters:
        search -

      • individual

        public RequestCreator individual()
        Threats this request as an individual article, rather than full feed. Use only if you are sure that the load URL belongs to a single article.

      • skipCache

        public RequestCreator skipCache()
        Ignores already cached responses when making this request. Useful for refreshing feeds/articles.

      • page

        public RequestCreator page(int page)
        Loads a specific page of the RSS feed.
        Parameters:
        page - Page to load.

      • nextPage

        public RequestCreator nextPage()
        Loads the next page of the current RSS feed. If no page was previously loaded, this will request the first page.

      • callback

        public RequestCreator callback(Callback callback)
        Adds a callback listener to this request.
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback interface to respond to.

      • get

        public java.util.List<Article> get()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Executes request and returns a full list containing all articles loaded from this request's URL.

        If this request is marked as individual, the list will contain only 1 index. It is recommended to use getFirst() for individual requests instead.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getFirst

        public Article getFirst()
        Executes request and returns the first Article associated with this request. This is useful for individual Article requests.

        May return null.

        Returns:
        Returns the first article associated with this request.

      • async

        public void async()
        Executes request asynchronously.

        Be sure to add a callback to handle this.
